sentences.english: In the last week of the holiday a strange thing happened.
sentences.chinese: 在假日的最后一个星期发生了一件怪事。

sentences.english: I haf not heard of such a thing.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有听说过这种怪事。

sentences.english: One evening he had a singular apparition.
sentences.chinese: 一天傍晚，他遇到一件怪事。

sentences.english: Dien Bien Phu saw one of the most bizarre happenings in modern warfare.
sentences.chinese: 奠边府战役中，发生了些现代战场上罕见的怪事。

sentences.english: He prophesied the strange events that were to come.
Roderick Lewis did three odd things yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 罗德里克刘易斯昨天做了三件怪事。

sentences.english: It is a queer business, apparently.
I wonder how seaworthy that over-sized bathtub really is?
sentences.chinese: 真是怪事，那个大澡盆似的破船怎么能航海？

sentences.english: According to He Ranfeng's recollection, Qiu Xinghua did two strange things that night.
sentences.chinese: 据何冉凤回忆，这天晚上，邱兴华接连做了两件怪事。

sentences.english: Then something very strange had happened to her.
sentences.chinese: 接下来在她身上发生了咄咄怪事。

sentences.english: This apparent paradox arises from attempting to understand the motion of microscopic particles.
sentences.chinese: 这个貌视的怪事来自于试图理解微观粒子的运动。

sentences.english: And in Atlanta, a bizarre incident at a gas station.
sentences.chinese: 亚特兰大一家加油站，发生了咄咄怪事。

sentences.english: After they went home, something bizarre happened: his sword turned out as an ordinary bamboo stick.
sentences.chinese: 回家之后，发生了怪事，宝剑竟然变成了普通的竹棒。

sentences.english: Such stereotypes often lead to unusual and sometimes amusing situations.
sentences.chinese: 这种成见常常会引发一些怪事，有时还会闹笑话。

sentences.english: Strange things are happening, persecutions are starting, and no one knows where it will end.
sentences.chinese: 许多怪事发生，迫害也开始了，没有人知道何时完结。

sentences.english: Since then, the village was cursed and the mansion subsequent inhabitant dies mysteriously.
sentences.chinese: 自此，荒村大宅接连发生怪事，宅人一一死去。

definition: an eccentric/odd person/person of extraordinary talent
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: nothing is too bizarre/full of extraordinary things
